INFORMATION  COMMUATION ENGINEERING Research Centre Recognition From 2019 (Affiliated to Anna University) Renewal up to December 2025 General Information Technology DEPARTMENT BROCHURE - Click here to download the Brochure Information Technology offers a four-year Bachelor of Technology Degree Course in the state of the art technology started in 1999. The Department is accredited by National Board of Accreditation and has an intake of 90, approved by All India Council for Technical Education Permanent Affiliation from Anna University Chennai. Accredited in 2007 (First time), Re-accredited in 2013 (Second time) for 2 years, Re-accredited third time in 2017 and Re-accredited fourth time in 2019 by National Board Accreditation, New Delhi  the accreditation status granted is valid upto 30.06.2022. Started offering Master of Engineering. in Computer Science and Engineering with specialization in Networks in the year 2013 with an intake of 18. At present the intake is 9

. At present the intake is 9. Infrastructure The department consists of seven laboratories viz CASE TOOLS Lab, DBMS Lab, FOSS Lab, MPMC Lab, WiFi Lab, Research and Development Lab and Networks Lab  One Industry Collaborated Honeywell Sentience Lab. We have our own Microprocessors, Microcontrollers and Interfacing kits for doing experiments under the University framed syllabus. The Department having, 208 computers 188-Desktops  20 Notebook some are loaded with Windows 7 and Windows 10 its applications, 25 Head Phones, 25 Logitech Web Camera are available. Exclusive library of more than 1300 books. NPTEL Repository  Spoken Tutorial IIT Bombay Contents is available in every Lab All classrooms are equipped with Multimedia Projector, Projector Screen, OHP, Blackboard and Wi-Fi enabled department. Faculty Dedicated and Industry experienced faculty members. Four faculty members are with Ph.D. qualifications, two are pursuing Ph

. Four faculty members are with Ph.D. qualifications, two are pursuing Ph.D and all other faculty members are with Master of EngineeringMaster of Technology qualification. Faculties are deputed for Guest Lecture  Expert Talk  Judges  Resource Person for FDP  Workshop  Seminar  Paper reviewed for Journals  Conferences. Membership in Institution of Engineers, Computer Society of India, Indian Society for Technical Education etc. For Every 25 Students one faculty will be acting as a counselor, One Student with one faculty counselor periodically performs counseling. Students Our students are working in TBI- INFINITY UNIQUERS Consulting and Services within our campus. We have produced 53 University Rank Holders. Students had undergone Remote Project Mentoring program in Honeywell Technologies Solutions, Madurai. Symposium, National  International Conference, Project Exhibition, Workshop, Seminar conducted for getting recent technical exposures

. Industry Visits and Inplant Training in Kodaikanal Solar Observatory, ISRO, BSNL, Doordharshan, Chettinad Cements, Tata Consultancy Services, Athena Health, etc. Industrial Projects at Tata Consultancy Services, InfoFace, Solaritis Technology Services, TVS Sundaram medical devices-Chennai, TVS Sundaram brake liners-Chennai and Honeywell Technology solutions. Special attention given to learn content beyond the syllabus for every subject. Every student has been a member in Special Interest Group (SIG). Our student has won many prizes in other college national  international events. Research and Development We have an exclusive Research and Development Lab. One faculty member is recognized as research supervisors by Anna University for guiding Ph.D  M.S. Scholars. Received funds from MSME for student projects. Balaji, Head of the DepartmentInformation Technology Seminar on Know Your Computer Mr.L.Murali (Technical Expert-CIICP)  Mr.Kannan (Lap top service Enggr) 071212 Mr. Marc Cantelmo, SMTS of Verizonm, USA delivered a seminar on Recent Trends in Information Technology  A special note on Cloud Computing at the IBM Center of Excellence Labs, hosted by the Department of Information Technology along with the Master of Computer Applications department, K.L.N. College of Engineering, Madurai on May 21, 2012. Dr.A.V. Ram Prasad, the Principal of the Institute welcomed Mr.Marc Cantelmo, followed by the guest introductory speech by Dr.N

.Marc Cantelmo, followed by the guest introductory speech by Dr.N.Balaji, the Head of the Information Technology Department. The seminar was felicitated by the President Shri.K.N.K.Ganesh and Joint Secretary Shri. G.R.Radha Krishnan. The faculty members from the allied departments like Computer Science and Engineering, Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering and the Postgraduate students attended the seminar. Mr. Marc Cantelmo possess vivid experience in Linux System administration and in Cloud Computing for more than 15 years. He shared his ideas on the recent developments in Cloud Computing area. He made a mention that the applications of cloud computing are practically limitless. Taking Cloud to education, a cloud environment may be setup for effective knowledge sharing and teaching which serves to be one of the best repaying investments

. Any field  Health Care, Research, Information Technology industry, Business, Backup Services, Banking  Cloud comes for the tech based infrastructure support. He then concluded the seminar after a vibrant Question-Answer session which was very fruitful. The seminar ended up well after the Vote of Thanks by Faculty Development Forum in-Charge Prof. A. Kannan of Master of Computer Applications department. Summarily the seminar enlightened the audience group and showed positive initiatives. SALIENT FEATURES OF THE DEPARTMENT HISTORY OF THE DEPARTMENT Programme Academic Year Duration Sanction Intake Bachelor of Engineering (Computer Science and Engineering) 1997-98 4 Yrs 40 1998-99 4 Yrs 60 2007-08 4 Yrs 120 Master of Engineering (Computer Science and Engineering) 2011-12 2 Yrs 18 2012-13 2 Yrs 24 ABOUT THE DEPARTMENT General The Computer Science and Engineering Department was established in the year 1997 and is four times accredited by National Board of Accreditation, New Delhi. The department is a recognized Research Centre under Anna University, Chennai. Master of Engineering (Computer Science and Engineering) Programme was started since Academic year 2010-11. Experienced faculty members transform their expertise through state of art facilities available in the department. The department focuses not only on academic excellence but also motivates the students towards skill enhancement in recent technological advancements

. The department has good rapport with industry and motivates the stakeholders to contribute effectively through innovative research, curriculum design etc. Each batch of students secure more number of placements offers in the premier organizations. Facilities in the department The department has competent and experienced faculty members catering to the needs of the students. The department has 6 doctorates, 2 recognized research supervisors and 6 faculty members pursuing Ph.D. The faculty members are well trained to bridge the industry academia gap. The department has 5 well equipped laboratories providing skill enhancement to the students and faculty member. The laboratories used exclusively for student academic skill development are Programming and Data Structures Laboratory, Advanced Computing Laboratory, Software Development and Simulation Laboratory, Project Laboratory

. The department also has an exclusive Research Laboratory catering to the research and consultancy needs of the faculty members and students. The department has an extensive well stocked library, exclusive seminar hall for the conduct of technical events, Research Reading Hall for research scholars of the research centre. All the classrooms are well equipped with smart teaching Artificial Intelligence and Data Science. VISION To evolve in the field of Computer Science  Engineering through sustainable technical education with innovative research and to foster competent professionals to serve and lead the society. MISSION  Imparting demand based proficient education through quality teaching  learning process in tune with the interdisciplinary needs of global work environment.  Inculcating the attitude of continuous learning through industry institution interaction, consultancy and research activities.  Cultivating professionalism, ethics and integrity of character for positive contributions to society

. Program Educational Objectives(PEOs) PEO I Contribute effectively to the society by applying principles of Computer Science and Engineering for analyzing the real world problems to produce optimal and sustainable technical solutions. PEO II Sustain as good professionals by pursuing career  advanced studies and practice innovation in emerging technologies and current trends through lifelong learning. PEO III Build professionalism, team work, effective communication, ethical values and leadership qualities. Program Specific Outcomes (PSOs) PSO1 Ability to apply good analytical, design and implementation skills to formulate and solve scientific and business applications pertaining to Algorithms, Computer Systems, Networks, Security, Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence

. PSO2 Ability to update knowledge continuously in various domains like Virtualization, Mobile Application Development, Data Visualization, Machine Learning and Technologies like Storage, Computing, Communication to meet the industry requirements. Computer Science and Engineering DEPARTMENT PROGRAM OUTCOMES COMPUTER SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING GRADUATES ARE ABLE TO: PO1: Engineering knowledge: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems. PO2: Problem analysis: Identify, formulate, research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences

. PO3: Designdevelopment of solutions: Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations. PO4: Conduct investigations of complex problems: Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions. PO5: Modern tool usage: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and Information Technology tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations

. PO6: The engineer and society: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice. PO7: Environment and sustainability: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development. PO8: Ethics: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice. PO9: Individual and team work: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings

. PO10: Communication: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions. PO11: Project management and finance: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to ones own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments. PO12: Life-long learning: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change. In an effort to improve the standard of education and enhance the wholesome development of our graduates, our renowned institution has adapted the Outcome Based Education model of National Board of Accreditation (National Board of Accreditation). Based on their scheme, the Department of Computer Science and Engineering has designed its Vision, Mission, Programme Educational Objectives (PEOs) and Programme Outcomes (POs)

. A crucial step in this procedure is to identify and assess the PEOs. PEOs are defined as the statements those describe the expected accomplishments of graduates, three to five years after graduation. VISION To create innovative pedagogy with the source of knowledge in the successive development of Computer Technology in current trends. MISSION To produce technically skillful, competent, employable, software professionals and researchers with social responsibilities and ethical values. About the Department Master of Computer Applications department was started in the year 1998 with an intake of 30 students. Intake has been increased to 60 in the year 2001. History of the department PROGRAM OF STUDY DESCRIPTION Master of Computer Applications Master of Computer Applications (Permanently Affiliated to Anna University) Started with 30 seats in 1997 F.No.TN-50MCP-Computer Science97 dt:23121997 (All India Council for Technical Education Approved) Intake increased to 60 in 1999 F.No

.No.TN-50MCP-Computer Science97 dt:581999 (All India Council for Technical Education Approved) Accreditation Status Accredited by National Board of Accreditation-All India Council for Technical Education in May 2007 for 3 Years F.No: National Board of AccreditationACCR-2422003 dt:2252007 Re-Accreditation Details Accredited by National Board of Accreditation-All India Council for Technical Education in August 2013 for 3 Years F.No:33-012010-National Board of Accreditation dt:14082013 Salient Features of the Department PROGRAM DESCRIPTION Master of Computer Applications MASTER OF COMPUTER APPLICATIONS (3 Years Full Time Programme) The Department is located in a separate double storeyed Postgraduate block of 2,520 square metre on the South Western side of the administrative Block. Department has 6 Class Rooms Department has Computer Lab with 60 systems, Computer Centre with 60 Systems, and Research Lab with 15 systems

. Separate Library facility made available to students with 9298 books with 10 National Journals and e-journals like J-Gate and facilities such as Delnet (Exclusively for Master of Computer Applications). Faculty Strength Faculty strength is 7. At present, 3 staff members have completed their Doctorate degrees. At present 2 staff members have completed their 20 years service and 5 staff members have completed their 10 years service in the department. Ideal Training Programs for Undergraduate Students 2 days in March or April month of every year Technical Symposium VYUHAM16 organized by Master of Computer Applications Department Medals to Academic toppers sponsored by Master of Computer Applications staff members Program Specific Objectives PSO 1: Enables a student to implement a high performing system by selecting appropriate data model, Architecture and Platform. PSO 2: Enable the students to design and develop application software for real time systems by integrating various system based components Program Educational Objectives PEO 1: To prepare the students for the future challenges in the field of computer applications by providing strong technical foundations PEO 2: To provide students various computing skills like analysis, design, coding for the development of innovative software products to excel in their profession

. PEO 3: To motivate the students to exhibit continuous improvement in their professional career through lifelong learning with societal ethics PEO 4: To motivate the students to function effectively in multi disciplinary teams, in various domains for the benefit of society Program Outcomes (Pos) PO1: Computational Knowledge: Apply knowledge of computing fundamentals, computing specialisation, mathematics, and domain knowledge appropriate for the computing specialisation to the abstraction and conceptualisation of computing models from defined problems and requirements. PO2: Problem Analysis: Identify, formulate, research literature, and solve complex computing problems reaching substantiated conclusions using fundamental principles of mathematics, computing sciences, and relevant domain disciplines

. PO3: Design Development of Solutions: Design and evaluate solutions for complex computing problems, and design and evaluate systems, components, or processes that meet specified needs with appropriate consideration for public health and safety, cultural, societal, and environmental considerations. PO4: Conduct investigations of complex Computing problems: Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of t h e information to provide valid conclusions. PO5: Modern Tool Usage: Create, select, adapt and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern computing tools to complex computing activities, with an understanding of the limitations. PO6: Professional Ethics: Understand and commit to professional ethics and cyber regulations, responsibilities, and norms of professional computing practices

. PO7: Life-long Learning: Recognise the need, and have the ability, to engage in independent learning for continual development as a computing professional. PO8: Project management and finance: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the computing and management principles and apply these to ones own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments. PO9: Communication Efficacy: Communicate effectively with the computing community, and with society at large, about complex computing activities by being able to comprehend and write effective reports, design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and understand clear instructions. PO10: Societal and Environmental Concern: Understand and assess societal, environmental, health, safety, legal, and cultural issues within local and global contexts, and the consequential responsibilities relevant to professional computing practices

. PO11: Individual and Team Work: Function effectively as an individual and as a member or leader in diverse teams and in multidisciplinary environments. PO12: Innovation and Entrepreneurship: Identify a timely opportunity and using innovation to pursue that opportunity to create value and wealth for the betterment of the individual and society at large. ASSOCIATION The Master of Computer Applications Department started its association in the year 2002 in the association name EITA- Emerging Information Technology  Association. Master of Computer Applications img1 This association was started with a vision of motivating students in par with current trends of the Information Technology industry. The association activities are as follows. Guest Lectures are arranged regularly to students. Group Discussions Mock Interview Mini Projects are guided by the staff members. Technical Symposiums. Technical Seminars. Sports and Athletics activities in Zone and state levels. Industrial Visits

. Technical Seminars. Sports and Athletics activities in Zone and state levels. Industrial Visits. Cultural Activities conducted by other colleges.
